# verify { #kedro_tdda.cli.verify }

```python
cli.verify(dataset_name=None, env='base')
```

The tdda verify command is used to validate pandas dataframes, 
against a constraints specification.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name         | Type            | Description                                                                                                                            | Default   |
|--------------|-----------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------|
| dataset_name | Optional\[str\] | Optional catalog name for the pandas dataset.  If not specified, verify will check constraints for every pandas dataset in the catalog | `None`    |
| env          | Optional\[str\] | Which conf/<env>/tdda folder to read constraints from                                                                                  | `'base'`  |

## Usage {.doc-section .doc-section-usage}

```sh
kedro verify
```
